Key Match Events: Oklahoma City Thunder outrebounded the Knicks 13-6 in the fourth quarter
Isaiah Hartenstein hauled in five rebounds in the fourth quarter despite being in foul trouble
Aaron Wiggins scored 15 points in the fourth quarter alone
Oklahoma City Thunder's Shai Gilgeous-Alexander had a 33-point outing
Isaiah Joe hit a three-pointer with less than four minutes remaining, giving Oklahoma City its first lead of the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Knicks had a nine-game winning streak
The Thunder had the best record in the NBA
The Knicks faced a challenge in rebounding and bench scoring
The Thunder extended their winning streak to 14 games
Post-Match Reflections: Josh Hart acknowledged the team needs to keep improving
Tom Thibodeau emphasized the need for stronger fourth-quarter defense
Josh Hart stated there were no positives and the team needs to execute better
The Knicks have upcoming games against the Thunder and Chicago Bulls
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks led by as much as 14 points in the game
Mikal Bridges talked with head coach Tom Thibodeau during a break in play
The Thunder's Jalen Williams celebrated a dunk against the Knicks
The Knicks missed on an opportunity to steal a headline victory
